IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of Sojourners is to articulate the biblical call to social justice, inspiring hope and building a movement to transform individuals, communities, the church and the world.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of Sojourners is to articulate the biblical call to social justice, inspiring hope and building a movement to transform individuals, communities, the church and the world.
IRS990.Desc: Description: Messaging & Media: Sojourners (www.sojo.net) broadens the public dialogue in the United States regarding the intersection of faith, public life and culture. Sojourners articulates a strong moral and religious imperative behind more just and responsible policies. This is done through both national media and our own media platforms (Sojourners magazine, social media, and our digital platforms), and through speaking tours and interviews of Sojourners' President Adam Taylor and other staff. Our digital publication is among the most read Christian social justice publications. More than 3.2 million people from across the world visited Sojourners' website in the last year. We offer analysis, news and commentary on current issues and events, and we produce a number of additional electronic and print resources for pastors and faith leaders.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Mobilization/Organizing Policy: For more than 50 years, Sojourners has been a connecting point for people of faith in this country and globally. Sojourners is challenging racism, xenophobia, sexism, and other efforts to divide us. In FY22, our key issues included countering racism in policing, supporting solutions to global conflicts, protecting the rights of immigrants and refugees, addressing poverty and inequalities, speaking out against xenophobia, protecting institutions of our democracy, training pastors to address gender-based violence, and preventing climate change, among other concerns.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Sojourners magazine: Sojourners magazine addresses issues of faith, politics, and culture from a biblical perspective. Sojourners magazine reaches 60,000 readers every month - educating, inspiring, and mobilizing readers to put their faith in action for social justice.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Education Resources: Sojourners provides educational resources through our website. All resources are mission-related. We create and distribute faith-based educational materials about poverty, the environment, racial justice, war and peace, and a range of other issues. Resources are available on our website (www.sojo.net).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: For the years ended June 30, 2022 and 2021, Sojourners has determined that no material uncertain tax positions qualify for either recognition or disclosure in the financial statements.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Mary Duong Rising Leaders Grant and RLF Self-Care Grant

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation Performance Officer maintains close contact with grant recipients to ensure that funds provided by Sojourners are used correctly. Detailed progress reports are obtained regularly from the recipients

The President of Sojourners receives certain specified benefits pursuant to his annual compensation agreement approved by the Executive Committee of the Board or its designee. This package includes certain home office expenses and other allowances detailed in the employment agreement. All of these items are grossed up for taxes and are included in the federal form W2 of the officer.

The maximum amount for each allowance is documented in the employment agreement with a specific accounting project code assigned to each allowance. All payment/reimbursements of these allowances are coded with the appropriate code and recorded in the accounting system. Taxable fringe benefits are added to the Dec 15 payroll each year and thus reflected on the W2.

Please see Schedule O, Part VI, for more about the executive compensation process. The following important points should also be noted: 1.The standards the board chose for all Sojourners organizational salaries are based on comparable market rates in Washington, DC for non-profit organizations based on position, size of organization, and years of experience. 2. As required by law, total compensation reported here includes, among other things, the cost of health insurance (an employer-paid benefit provided to all Sojourner's staff), and contributions for retirement and life insurance.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Sojourners engages a certified public accountant to prepare the federal form 990. The federal form 990 is reviewed and approved by the Chief Financial Officer and the return is signed, after review, by another officer of the corporation. Prior to filing the form 990, a PDF version of the return is sent to all board members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Key employees, officers, and members of the Board of Directors are required to review the Conflict of Interest policy and acknowledge that they have done so in writing to the organization. Annually, each of the above individuals must complete a disclosure form identifying any potential relationships, positions, or circumstances in which the individual, member of their family, or an organization in which the individual serves as an owner, officer, or director is involved that he or she believes could contribute to a conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The salary and benefits of the President are reviewed annually by an independent committee of the Board of Directors based on market data for similar positions in the Washington DC area. The committee meets in executive session and therefore no minutes are maintained for these meetings. However, the decisions reached by the compensation committee are memorialized in a compensation agreement between the organization and the President which details all compensation and fringe benefits to be received in the upcoming year. Key employees and compensated officers of the corporation are subject to the salary administration system of the organization as are all other employees. The salary ranges for each position were determined through market based salary surveys for nonprofits of similar size and scope. Employees' pay is maintained within these market based ranges and subject to annual review and with a possibility of merit increase. Salary administration is managed by the Chief Executive Officer and the Vice President for Human Resources. All salary decisions are documented in the employees personnel file. Please see Schedule J, Part III, for more about executive compensation details

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Not made available to the public.
